Class PuzzleGeneration

java.lang.Object
  com.isolace.sudoku.server.PuzzleGeneration

public class PuzzleGeneration
extends java.lang.Object

Handles generation of a puzzle and it's revealed items.

getAmbiguousIndexes

public static final int[] getAmbiguousIndexes(int[] puzzle)
A puzzle should have just one solution. This method looks for pairs of numbers that are inter-changeable allowing for more than one solution.

Parameters:
puzzle - The puzzle to be analyzed.
Returns:
Array of indexes that can result in more than one solution.

generateRevealed

public static final int[] generateRevealed(int level,
                                           int[] puzzle,
                                           int[] ambiguous)
Returns an array of indexes to be revealed to the user at the start of a game. The easier the level the more clues that are revealed.

Parameters:
level - Game level.
puzzle - Game puzzle.
ambiguous - Array of ambiguous indexes.
Returns:
An array of indexes to be revealed
See Also:
getAmbiguousIndexes(int[])

generate

public static final int[] generate()
Generate a puzzle. This is a slow, brute force method to generated puzzles. The speed could be greatly enhanced by being more judicious with Random.

Returns:
An 81 int array representing a Sudoku puzzle.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
